page.title: 09ON THE MOORS...
page.content: Along the misty moors...The damp cold fog clinging to our hair.The boggy parts,and a little stream moving very slowly.Walking in a forgotten place,deserted,bare.All you can see is dead bracken and a sudden swirl of thick fog. {The Portway}where the Romans marched along,many years ago...The chinking of the armour and the plodding of the horses hooves. In a pond a grave stone lying in the water half in and half out with the initials "TBC" on it.The mist flies with the wind across the moors.Creepy, very cold,the wind tingles down my spine. The mini-bus in sight-{"Charge!Get {in,grab a seat!Oh,a sit down at {last!"}We drive through the mist the, landscape out of sight as we drive.We can only see five metres ahead...
